Articles.Content:
I accidentally uninstalled my KSP version 0.24 from my computer.

Is there a way I can get that back without having to pay for a new program?

I'm also trying to find the new version, 0.25 on Steam and the KSP store but couldn't find it.

Did you buy it the first time????

You can go to the store to re-download it. Or if you got Steam version, you can download it again from Steam, and use the key which you can find in your KSP account.
redownload it from the same place you originally did.

KSP 0.25 is a free update, so you should be able to download it from the same store where you bought 0.24. If you bought it on the KSP Store, just log in to your account, then click My Account in the top right, and the big blue download button. You can download the current and previous version.

On Steam, you should be able to re-download, though I don't use it myself. For the previous version, look for "Previous Beta."

The current version and the previous version are available for download: at the time of writing .25 and .24 respectively. On the store I think you can just pick.

On Steam the previous version is available under "Betas", by right-clicking on the game name in the library.
Did you also clear your recycling bin?
Yes, I bought it. And have found the part in my account where to download the program. From others that responded to this thread

KSP 0.25 is a free update, so you should be able to download it from the same store where you bought 0.24. If you bought it on the KSP Store, just log in to your account, then click My Account in the top right, and the big blue download button. You can download the current and previous version.

On Steam, you should be able to re-download, though I don't use it myself. For the previous version, look for "Previous Beta."

Thank you Master Tao. I found the both versions under my account tab. Now I'm ready to fly again
